availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John F. Donaly (Louisville, Kentucky, plumber and gas fitter)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, plumber and gas fitter. New York native. Son of Patrick Donaly and Ann Donaly. Married to Margaret J. Donaly. Father of Mary E. Donaly, Eliza Louisa Donaly, Joseph D. Donaly, and Matilda Donaly. Laborer in Saint Lawrence County, New York, in 1850. Plumber and gas fitter in partnership with Charles M. Strader in Donaly & Strader in Louisville from 1859 to 1863. Plumber in Louisville in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, New York, Sant Lawrence County, Madrid, p. 261B.

Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, District 10, p. 314B.
"No. 103 Third St.," The Louisville Daily Journal, (Louisville, KY), December 30, 1859, p. 2.
"Plumbing, Gas and Steam Fitting," The Louisville Daily Journal, (Louisville, KY), July 9, 1863, p. 2.
